title: Changes in real GDP and the multipliers

content.description:
Include correctly labeled diagrams, if useful or required, in explaining your answers. A correctly labeled diagram must have all axes and curves clearly labeled and must show directional changes. If the question prompts you to “Calculate,” you must show how you arrived at your final answer.

The table below provides data on the spending on final goods, in billions of dollars, by consumers, businesses, and the government in equilibrium in a country with no international trade.

Aggregate Variables
 Value (in billions of dollars) in the base year

Consumption spending
 <math alttext="$900"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>900</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

Investment spending
 <math alttext="$400"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>400</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

Government spending
 <math alttext="$200"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>200</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

Transfer payments
 <math alttext="$60"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>60</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

The marginal propensity to save is equal to <math alttext="0.4"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and there are no exports or imports.

(a) Calculate the real <math alttext="G D P"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in this country. Show your work.

(b) Calculate the marginal propensity to consume. Show your work.

(c) Suppose that the government increases spending from <math alttext="$200"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>200</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> billion to <math alttext="$300"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>300</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> billion.

(i) Calculate the maximum change in real <math alttext="G D P"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Show your work.

(ii) Given the change in real <math alttext="G D P"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in part (c)(i), calculate the maximum level of the new equilibrium real <math alttext="G D P"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Show your work.

(d) Suppose that taxes decrease by <math alttext="$100"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> billion. Will the maximum change in real <math alttext="G D P"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> be larger than, smaller than, or equal to the change in real <math alttext="G D P"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> identified in part (c)(i) ? Explain.
